column5: Has anyone used Berkley Ripple Shad while fishing walleye in Canada. If so, how did they work? Good? Ok? Bad?

They work pretty good in northwestern ontario lakes/rivers. Pike and bass also love to eat them.I prefer the 3" as apposed to the 4" versions.I use them on jigs, usually 1/4 oz or 3/8 oz. I like both the minnow and the perch versions.I usually use them when the bite is tough, then the paddletail seems to produce bites when other baits aren't working.a jig retrieve is how I fish them, try different speeds etc
we have been using since last year. We have used several colors. Works best in current.
We are going to Peffley's on Wabaskang in August and just wondered about taking them. Thanks for the info.
I have some people that are doing well on Eagle this week using them....... I would give them a thumbs up!
